bibl.title: The Kasr of Saint Mary Baramus Monastery after the Last Restoration from 1994 to 1995.

with the assistance of Maarten KERSTEN and Carolien VAN ZOEST, Coptic Studies on the Treshold of a New Millennium. Proceedings of the Seventh International Congress of Coptic Studies. Leiden, 27 August - 2 September 2000. II
bibl.author: ZAKARIA AL-BARAMUSI, (Father)

bibl.note: Kasr, or keep, restored by the Baramus Monastery (Deir al-Baramus) under supervision of the Egyptian Antiquities Organization. The original kasr may have been built in the fifth or sixth century, and consisted of two floors.
ZAKARIA AL-BARAMUSI (Father), The Kasr of Saint Mary Baramus Monastery after the Last Restoration from 1994 to 1995.

Mat IMMERZEEL and Jacques VAN DER VLIET (Edd.), with the assistance of Maarten KERSTEN and Carolien VAN ZOEST, Coptic Studies on the Treshold of a New Millennium. Proceedings of the Seventh International Congress of Coptic Studies. Leiden, 27 August - 2 September 2000. II = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 133 (Leuven, 2004) pp. 1105-1118, 9 figg.
